H0.text: Shape is the characteristic that best identifies a pure substance.

H1.text: Texture is the characteristic that best identifies a pure substance.

H2.text: Melting point is the characteristic that best identifies a pure substance.

H3.text: State of matter is the characteristic that best identifies a pure substance.

A4.text: The melting point of a pure substance is always higher and has a smaller range than the melting point of an impure substance or, more generally, of mixtures.

A5.text: Melting points are often used to characterize organic and inorganic compounds and to ascertain their purity.
